entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Increase one ability score of your choice by 2 and another ability score of your choice by 1.

entries.name: Size
entries: Terran races vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Language Proficiencies
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common. You also learn a second language that is depending on the race of your choice. The spreadsheet at the end of the races will show what language your character will learn.

entries.name: Age
entries: Age works strangely in this setting, as all races have the normal human lifespan, but it can be longer than that by quite a lot of means. Someone can be naturally long living, some casters managed to prolong their life and many other unexplained ways, and it is not race dependent, as it is observed in most of the races in Terra. Note that, in this setting the longer a person lives, the more powerful it becomes and the more secrets it holds, so discuss the age of your character with your DM carefully.

entries: template

entries.name: Archosauria
entries: Archosaurians have the traits of crocodilians, which can be seen from the shape of their scaly tails. They also have long, pointed ears similar to that of Sarkaz, and some Archosaurians also have scales on their body. All known male Archosaurians are anthropomorphic but all female Archosaurians are humanoid, suggesting some form of sexual dimorphism within the race. They hail from Sargon’s vast jungles, where they live tribal life with constant conflict between each other.

entries.name: Adept in Conflict
entries: You gain proficiency in simple and martial weapons. You also gain proficiency in shields.

entries.name: Strong Jaws
entries: You gain a bite attack, which counts as an unarmed strike and deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier piercing damage. In addition, if you grapple or restrain an enemy you can use a bonus action to attack them with this bite attack. Your bite attacks have advantage against grappled targets.

entries.name: Tribal Tactics
entries: You can make simple traps using your environment. Spending 5 minutes quickly gathering materials and assembling them into a barely functioning contraption. Your traps use your Wisdom to determinate their saving throw DC. The DC is 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier. Placing traps requires 1 minute and you can only place them within 5 feet of you. If a creature is making a skill check to detect your traps, they make the skill check against the DC determined by this trait. You can make up to 3 traps with this feature and carry them with yourself.
You can make the following traps:

items: Restraining Trap: You place this small sized trap on the ground. Whenever a creature steps on it, it must make a Dexterity saving throw or become grappled. After they get caught in this trap, they can use their action to make an Athletics check against your trap DC to escape it. After the trap is used, by a creature triggering it or escaping from it, the trap is destroyed.

Tripping Trap: You make a 15-feet long 5-feet wide contraption, which you attach to two solid surfaces or onto the ground. The first time a creature enters the space of the trap they have to make a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. After triggering this trap, it is revealed to everyone and its space becomes difficult terrain until it’s removed.

Launching Trap : You make a medium sized contraption, which you place on the ground or on a solid surface. When a creature comes into contact with the trap, they must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked back into the opposite direction the trap is facing by 15 feet and are knocked prone. Only large or smaller creatures can be affected by this trap. After the trap is used, by a creature triggering it, the trap is destroyed.

entries.name: Anura
entries: Anuras have the traits of frogs, but similar to the Aegirs, they are entirely humanoid, making their frog traits, i.e. patches of frog-like skin, barely noticeable. Some might also have the ability to secrete poison. However, whether there would be Anuras with more obvious traits is still debatable. Anuras are a mysterious race, they are quite rare among the other races of Terra and no larger group or community is known to the current date. They are assimilated into the known nations, adopted their culture, but because of their bodies, they face some difficulties with their everyday life. This race only has humanoid variants.

entries.name: Poisonous Body and Skin
entries: Your body creates a poison unique to you and you can use this to your advantage.
This trait grants you the following benefits:

items: Whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack within 5 feet of you, they will take poison damage equal to your proficiency bonus. If you are hit by a bite attack, they take double damage from this trait.
You gain advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and taking poison damage.
You gain resistance to poison damage.

While you are physically grappling or restraining a creature or you are being grappled or restrained by a creature, the creature will take poison damage equal to your proficiency bonus at the start of its turn.

As a bonus action you can coat a melee weapon or a piece of ammunition with your poison. The coating remains on the weapon for 1 minute or until you successfully hit a creature with the weapon. On a hit the target has to make a Constitution saving throw against 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. On a failure the creature takes poison damage equal to your proficiency bonus and becomes poisoned until the start of your next turn. On a success, they take half damage and aren’t poisoned. You can apply this coating a number of times equal to 2 x your proficiency bonus and regain the ability to do so on a short rest.
Your poison loses potency after 1 minute if it loses contact with your body, making it impossible to store for later uses for other creatures.

entries.name: Anaty
entries: Anaties have the traits of musteloids, which include otters, weasels, raccoons, and wolverines. Their musteloid traits can be seen from the shape of their ears and tail, though not all Anaty have animal ears. Anaties are quite common at the northern regions of Terra, but their place of origin is yet to be known. Their acrobatic bodies are adept in climbing thanks to their strong palms and fingers so they can easily become trained assassins and thieves. On top of that as technology got more and more advanced, most of them picked up an interest in small machinery and became well known mechanists. This race only has humanoid variants.

entries.name: Adept Climbers
entries: You gain climbing speed equal to your movement speed.

entries.name: Acrobatic Body
entries: You gain proficiency in Acrobatics. In addition, if you gain proficiency in Acrobatics from other sources, such as class or background, this trait grants you expertise instead.

entries.name: Creators
entries: You gain proficiency with Tinker’s Tools. In addition, if you gain proficiency in Tinker’s Tool from other sources, such as class or background, this trait grants you expertise instead. Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 25 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny originium device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function if it is reduced to 0 HP or you use your Action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. Whenever you create a device, choose up to 2 properties from the list below. You can choose the same property twice and gain an enchanted effect of that property. If a device can function up to a specified amount of time and have different properties, they can maintain their function separately up to the time specified to them. If you activate both properties at the same time, they will maintain function until one of them reaches their maximum function time and the device will consume both properties' functionality. If a device reaches its maximum uptime, you need to spend 10 minutes with the device to restore it to function. Whenever you create the device you determine how their functions look or sound like. If you want to modify them, like make the device create a different sound and another image, you need to spend 10 minutes of work with it. If a device requires a creature to make a saving throw, the DC is 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier. You can activate a device by touching it and must use your action to do so, but you can throw it 30 feet away with the same action.

items.name: Light
entries: The device can emanate bright light in a 30 feet cone and dim light in an additional 30 feet up to an hour. Enchanted effect: Doubles to range of the lighting and can function until turned off. Also, you turn this device into a flashbang, which you can throw to a point within 30 feet of you. Creatures within 10 feet of that point must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, their next attack will be at disadvantage. After you used it this way, the device is destroyed.

items.name: Sound
entries: The device can create any sound up to an hour, and it can only be heard up to 60 feet. You can adjust the volume of the device. Enchanted effect: The device can operate for more than an hour now, until it is turned off and its sound can be heard up to 300 feet. You can also turn this device into a sound bomb, which you can throw to a point within 30 feet of you. Creatures within 10 feet of that point must make a Constitution saving throw or become deafened for 1 minute. After you used it this way, the device is destroyed.

items.name: Image
entries: The device can create a stationary image up to Small size and remains functional for up to 5 minutes. Enchanted effect: The device can create an image up to Large size and can remain functional up to an hour. The image doesn’t need to be stationary anymore.

entries.name: Ægir
entries: Aegirs have the traits of various marine animals such as fishes, cetaceans, cephalopods, echinoderms, cnidarians, crustaceans, and pinnipeds. However, most Aegir are entirely humanoid, making their animalistic traits barely noticeable. All Aegir come from the oceans beyond the known world of Terra. On land, the Aegirs have to face the issues of dry skin. If left untreated, they will face severe symptoms like allergic reactions and chafing. Even though they hail from the ocean, ironically, a fair amount of them lack amphibious traits (i.e., breathing underwater), hence the reason why many Aegir cities are built within domes. They have a special connection with each other through song. To them, these songs are so special, that they don’t share them with land dwellers, only the ones they trust deeply. Because of their shared place of origin, Aegir can easily be corrupted into Seaborn either through scientific experiments, by succumbing to the monsters' alluring influence on the mind, or by being forcefully implanted Seaborn cells. Aegirs didn’t come into contact with originium, somehow the ocean granted them protection from it, only after some of them started to migrate to land, so their technology and methods are entirely foreign to land dwellers. This race only has humanoid variants.

entries.name: People of the Ocean
entries: You gain 50 feet swimming speed and the ability to breathe underwater.

entries.name: Culture of Singing
entries: You gain proficiency in Performance. In addition, if you gain proficiency in Performance from other sources, such as class or background, this trait grants you expertise instead.

entries.name: Refugees of an Advanced Civilization
entries: You gain proficiency in all land and water vehicles. In addition, you have advantage on ability checks to figure out, understand or use highly advanced technological equipment and machines.

entries.name: Unfamiliar with Originium.
entries: You can use arts devices normally, as Aegirs spend enough time on land to learn and adept, but you have an alternative way to use your arts. You can ignore the somatic and material components of your spells, if they don’t require them to have an item with a specific value, and you don’t need to use arts devices anymore. However, if you forgo to use art devices, all your spells will have verbal components, as you use your song to manifest them.

entries.name: Cautus
entries: Cautuses have the traits of leporids (rabbits and hares), which can be seen from the shape of their ears, in fact they have both rabbit and humanoid ears, giving them exceptional hearing. They do have tails, which is largely unnoticeable due to the short length. As a matter of fact, they are often nicknamed as "rabbits." Most Cautuses are born in Rim Billiton. This race only has humanoid variants

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Perceptive Fighter
entries: You have blindsight with a range of 5 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you. You can only benefit from this trait if you aren’t deafened.

entries.name: Detect
entries: You can use a bonus action to make Wisdom (Perception) checks. In addition, you can try to detect invisible creatures you are hearing within 20 feet of you. Make a Wisdom (Perception) check against the creatures Dexterity (Stealth). On a success, the other creature won’t gain any benefits for being invisible against you, but you still cannot use spells on it, if it requires you to see the target, and you can now make opportunity attacks against the creature. If the creature moves more than 20 feet away from you, it will regain the benefits of invisibility again and you need to make another skill contest following the rules of this trait again to gain the same benefit again.

entries.name: Corporate Born
entries: You can add your proficiency bonus one additional time to Charisma skill check made for trading, bargaining and bribing.
